intro: Cyrtandra geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive twin-flowered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
